feat.name: Greater Dragonmark
entries: Your dragonmark has grown in size and power. This enhances your existing dragonmark, and the benefits are based on the mark that you already possess. A greater dragonmark provides the following benefits:

items: The die type of your dragonmarked Intuition Die increases by one (for example, from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}).
Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. The abilities available to you are based on your mark, as shown on the Greater Dragonmark Benefits table.

You learn a set of spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot or using a material component. The list of spells, the spellcasting ability for them, and the type of rest you must complete to regain the use of these spells are shown on the Greater Dragonmark Benefits table.

entries.caption: Greater Dragonmark Benefits
rows: {@race half-orc (mark of finding)|ERLW|Find}{@race human (mark of finding)|ERLW|ing}
{@spell Knock}, {@spell Glyph of Warding}, {@spell Leomund's Secret Chest}*
footnotes: *To cast {@spell Leomund's secret chest} using this feat and the {@race dwarf (mark of warding)|ERLW|Mark of Warding}, you must have a {@item Siberys dragonshard|ERLW} with a value of at least 100 gp. While you have this dragonshard in hand, it serves as the spell's focus, and you can use it to summon and dismiss the chest.

itemGroup.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper

+2 Rod of the Pact Keeper
+3 Rod of the Pact Keeper

item.name: Eberron dragonshard
entries: A rosy crystal with crimson swirls flowing in its depths, typically refined into a glowing powder.

When casting a spell, you can use Eberron dragonshard dust in place of any spell component that has a cost, unless the DM says otherwise (the dust's market value is the same as the replaced component).

item.name: Khyber dragonshard
entries: A deep blue or dark violet crystal laced with gleaming veins.

item.name: Siberys dragonshard
entries: An amber colored crystal with swirling golden veins gleaming within.

item.name: Prayers
entries: If Prayers become separated from {@item Thoughts|BrewskiThoughtsPrayers}, either by moving into a different plane or via 300 ft. of distance, any creature in possession of Prayers must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d10} radiant damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
While you are attuned to Prayers and wearing it on your hand, you receive the following benefits:

items: You regenerate {@dice 1d4} Hit Points at the start of each turn.
Whenever you succeed on a melee attack using Prayers, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

entries: Additionally, Prayers contains 6 charges. You can use an action to expend 2 or more charges to cast one of the following spells at level 5 (save {@dc 18}) from it:

items: {@spell Wall of Light|XGE} (3 charges)
{@spell Guiding Bolt} (2 charges)

entries: Prayers regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: When Used Together
entries: While wearing and attuned to both weapons, the damage dice used when calculating psychic/radiant damage as a result of a melee attack becomes {@damage 4d6}. Additionally, each weapon gains +2 to its maximum charges and you may make 1 extra attack each time you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you class does not have special rules for handling unarmed strikes, each weapon functions as a light weapon for you, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your strength modifier + your proficiency bonus while you area ttuned to it. While unattuned, it instead gives you +1 to unarmed strike damage.
If your class has special rules for handling unarmed strikes, each weapon provides +3 to your unarmed strike damage roles, only while you are attuned to it.

Thoughts & Prayers are a pair of twin {@item knuckleduster|Valnoa|knuckledusters}. Each is molded from the same type of metal but, whereas Thoughts is almost fully black in color, Prayers is almost white. Each can be used independently of the other, however they are more powerful when used together by a single creature.

item.name: Thoughts
entries: If Thoughts becomes separated from {@item Prayers|BrewskiThoughtsPrayers}, either by moving into a different plane or via 300 ft. of distance, any creature in possession of Thoughts must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d10} psychic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
While you are attuned to Thoughts and wearing it on your hand, you receive the following benefits:

items: You get +2 to Wisdom saving throws.
Whenever you succeed on a melee attack using Thoughts, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

entries: Additionally, Thoughts contains 6 charges. You can use an action to expend 2 or more charges to cast one of the following spells at level 5 (save {@dc 18}) from it:

items: {@spell Dissonant Whispers} (3 charges)
{@spell Vicious Mockery} (2 charges)

entries: Thoughts regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: When Used Together
entries: While wearing and attuned to both weapons, the damage dice used when calculating psychic/radiant damage as a result of a melee attack becomes {@damage 4d6}. Additionally, each weapon gains +2 to its maximum charges and you may make 1 extra attack each time you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you class does not have special rules for handling unarmed strikes, each weapon functions as a light weapon for you, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your strength modifier + your proficiency bonus while you area ttuned to it. While unattuned, it instead gives you +1 to unarmed strike damage.
If your class has special rules for handling unarmed strikes, each weapon provides +3 to your unarmed strike damage roles, only while you are attuned to it.

Thoughts & Prayers are a pair of twin {@item knuckleduster|Valnoa|knuckledusters}. Each is molded from the same type of metal but, whereas Thoughts is almost fully black in color, Prayers is almost white. Each can be used independently of the other, however they are more powerful when used together by a single creature.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Red Jade Dog
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature blink dog||Red Jade Dog}.
This onyx statuette of a dog can become a {@creature blink dog} or {@creature blink wolf|Valnoa} for up to 6 hours. The statuette has two charges and regains all expended charges at dawn.

item.name: Tear of Sehanine
entries: Upon death, the wearer's soul is bound to the crystal. The person is still partially aware of outside stimuli.

item.name: Vermillion Red Robes
entries: This bright red robe is the uniform of the Red Wizards of Thay. While you wear it, your Armor Class is 12 + your Dex modifier, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear it.

item.name: Wax Harper Seal
entries: This wax seal bears the symbol of the Harpers. As an action, you can break the seal and activate a long distance {@spell Alarm} spell. The spell sends a mental alarm to Storm Silverhand, which broadcasts the location at which the seal was broken.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a miss, the boomerang returns to the thrower's hand.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you have the {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} feature, wielding a knuckleduster counts as an unarmed strike rather than a weapon attack. Any special properties of the knuckleduster are applied to your unarmed strike.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Drizzt has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Drizzt to sleep.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Drizzt's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: Once per rest, Drizzt can reroll a saving throw that he fails and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Close Quarters Shooter
entries: When making a ranged attack while within 5 feet of a hostile creature, Drizzt does not have disadvantage on the attack roll. His ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30 feet of him.

trait.name: Natural Explorer: Underdark, Mountains
entries: When Drizzt makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to mountains or the Underdark, his proficiency bonus is doubled if he is using a skill that he's proficient in.

trait.name: Favored Foe
entries: When Drizzt hits a creature with an attack roll, he can mark the target as his favored enemy for 1 minute or until he loses concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). The first time on each of Drizzt's turns that he hits the favored enemy and deal damage to it, he deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage. He can use this feature to mark a favored enemy 6 times.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs Drizzt no extra movement, and he can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by or taking damage from them. Drizzt also has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Defensive Tactics: Steel Will
entries: Drizzt has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Drizzt makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

action.name: Icingdeath
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Taulmaril
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 15} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage. The arrow is considered silvered.

action.name: Hunter's Prey: Colossus Slayer
entries: Once per turn when Drizzt hits a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage if it's below its hit point maximum.

action.name: Primeval Awareness
entries: Drizzt can expend one spell slot to focus his awareness on the region around him. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot he expends, he can sense whether the following types of creatures are present within 1 mile of him (or within up to 6 miles if he is in mountains or the Underdark): {@filter aberrations|bestiary|type=aberration}, {@filter celestials|bestiary|type=celestial}, {@filter dragons|bestiary|type=dragon}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter fey|bestiary|type=fey}, {@filter fiends|bestiary|type=fiend}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead}. This feature doesn't reveal the creatures' location or number.

action.name: Action Surge
entries: Once per rest, Drizzt can take one additional action on top of his regular action.

spellcasting.name: Drow Magic
headerEntries: Drizzt's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Drizzt is an 8th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Drizzt has the following ranger spells prepared:

bonus.name: Second Wind
entries: Once per rest, Drizzt can use a bonus action to regain {@dice 1d10 + 11} hit points.

bonus.name: Twinkle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Blink Wolf
languages: understands Sylvan but can't speak it

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Teleport {@recharge 4}
entries: The dog magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Before or after teleporting, the dog can make one bite attack.

A blink dog takes its name from its ability to blink in and out of existence, a talent it uses to aid its attacks and to avoid harm. Blink dogs harbor a long-standing hatred for displacer beasts and attack them on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Irelenna's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Enchanting Presence
entries: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of Irelenna must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by Irelenna for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Enchanting Presence for 24 hours.
Whenever Irelenna deals damage to the {@condition charmed} creature, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Fey Step {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, Irelenna can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Irelenna has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

reaction.name: Foster Peace
entries: If a creature {@condition charmed} by Irelenna hits with an attack roll while within 60 feet of her, Irelenna magically causes the attack to miss, provided she can see the attacker.

reaction.name: Polearm Master
entries: While wielding a {@item glaive|PHB}, {@item halberd|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, {@item quarterstaff|PHB}, or {@item spear|PHB}, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from Irelenna when they enter her reach.

reaction.name: Sentinel
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from Irelenna even if they take the {@action Disengage} action before leaving her reach. When Irelenna hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.
In addition, when a creature within 5 feet of Irelenna makes an attack against a target other than her, she can use her reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.
To be not just ruled by emotions, but physically changed by them? Better to have no emotions at all.

entries.name: Autumn Eladrin
entries: Eladrin often enter the autumn season when they are overcome by feelings of goodwill. In this aspect, they defuse conflicts and alleviate suffering by using their magic to heal, to cure, and to relieve any ailment that might afflict the people who come to them for aid. They tolerate no violence in their presence and move quickly to settle disputes, to ensure that peace continues to reign.

entries.name: Eladrin
entries: Eladrin dwell in the verdant splendor of the Feywild. They are related to the elves found on the Material Plane, and resemble them in both their love of beauty and the value they place on personal freedom. But where other elves can temper their wild impulses, eladrin are creatures ruled by emotion—and because of their unique magical nature, they undergo physical changes to match their changes in temperament.

The eladrin have spent centuries in the Feywild, and most of them have become fey creatures as a result. Some of them are still humanoid, similar in that respect to their other elven kin. The eladrin presented here are of the fey variety.

entries.name: Creatures of Passion
entries: The magic flowing through eladrin responds to their emotional state by transforming them into different seasonal aspects, with behaviors and capabilities that change with their forms. Some eladrin might remain in a particular aspect for years, while others run through the emotional spectrum each week.

entries.name: Lovers of Beauty
entries: Regardless of the aspect they express, eladrin love beauty and surround themselves with lovely things. Eladrin try to possess any objects they find striking. They might seek to own a painting, a statue, or a glittering jewel. When they encounter people of comely form or luminous spirit, they use their magic to delight those folk or, in the case of evil eladrin, to abduct them.

entries.name: Changeable Nature
entries: Whenever one of the eladrin presented here finishes a long rest, it can associate itself with a different season, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}. When the eladrin makes this change, it uses the stat block of the new season, rather than its old stat block. Any damage the eladrin sustained in its original form applies to the new form, as do any conditions or other ongoing effects affecting it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Irelenna attacks twice with one of her weapons.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Fey Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespan—typically a century or less. Created changelings are more likely to die at an early age due to complications. While a changeling can shapeshift to conceal their age, the effects of aging still catch up to them.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: As most changelings are owned by Thay, many perform an alignment of lawful evil, even if they themselves do not subscribe to it. Due to prolonged psychic damage, most created changelings have little free will of their own.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form, you are knocked {@condition unconscious}, or you die.

entries.name: Changeling Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}.

entries.name: Unsettling Visage
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You must use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Using this trait reveals your shapeshifting nature to any creature within 30 feet that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Divergent Persona
entries: You gain proficiency with one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice. Define a persona associated with that proficiency: establish the name, race, gender, age, and other details. While you are in the form of this persona, the related proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses that proficiency.

This persona is part of you, but largely is beyond your control and behaves as if it has a consciousness of its own. If you are a created changeling, it is a mechanism implanted by Thay to prevent you from sharing information about their nation with outsiders. If you are a born changeling, it may manifest differently based on its own personality. Often, your character will have no memory of time spent as your Divergent Persona, though this may differ based on your knowledge of your persona and your relationship to it.

entries.name: Psionic Exposure
entries: Linked by a psychic web intrinsic in their DNA, changelings have powers unknown to the rest of the material plane. You know one {@filter Psionic Talent|psionics|source=null|type=T} of your choice from the {@class Mystic|UATheMysticClass} class. You can use this talent once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your psionic talent.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

Created in Thay with the same experimentation that created monstrosities such as Chimeras and Manticores, the "pale ones" are largely unknown to the rest of the material plane—but that doesn't mean they aren't present within it.

entries.name: Biological Shifter Experiments
entries: A spy who could disguise themselves as anyone, at any time, without being detectable by magic. This was the goal Thay set out to achieve, and the changelings were the race that they created.

All changelings originate in Thay, whether created from other humanoid races or born naturally from changeling parents. They are groomed from their first moments to be assassins and spies, indoctrinating them to Thaycian ideals while training their unique ability called "Psionics": spell-like effects created with the power of the mind rather than the weave. But a race undetectable to their enemies is also undetectable to them—and while difficult, it is not impossible for a changeling to escape the hold and reach of their creators.

In creating a changeling adventurer, consider the character's connection to their origins. Does the character work to further the goals of Thay? Do they push against them? Were they raised in the country amongst others like them or were taken away from it, thinking they are the only of their kind?

entries.name: Masks and Personas
entries: In their true form, changelings are pale, with colorless eyes and pale-toned hair, though each changeling usually has one unique area of odd colorization that differentiates them from others. It is rare to see a changeling in that form, for a typical changeling changes their shape in order to remain undiscovered. Created changelings often adopt casual shapes—ones created on the spur of the moment, with no depth or history—for strictly utilitarian purposes. However, born changelings often develop identities that have more depth. They build an identity over time, crafting a mask with its own history and beliefs. This focused identity helps a changeling pinpoint a particular skill or virtue. A changeling adventurer might have masks for many situations, including negotiation, investigation, and combat.

Personas differ from masks in that each changeling possesses only one, and it is a consciousness of its own, though based within and around the experiences of the changeling; for example, a persona's appearance and personality may be influenced by someone a changeling met briefly when they were young. It is uncertain where this persona comes from, though the large amount of psychic energy changelings possess may be a contributing factor. While Thay grooms the personas of their changelings to function as a "self-destruct switch," changelings raised outside of Thay's influence may have personas that serve any functionality.

entries.name: Changeling Names
entries: A changeling might use a different name for each mask and adopt new names as easily as they change faces. Within Thay, changelings are not given names, only serial numbers; however, changelings that choose their own name often choose one that is simple and monosyllabic. Rather than a name, individual changelings often will have a common visual trait across multiple masks that allows friends and family to identify them. So, a changeling may have seven masks, but each mask has the same colored eyes or the same hairstyle regardless of their differences.
Changelings are raised by Thay to remain as one sex for breeding purposes, but not all changelings abide by this rule or feel it represents their gender identity.
{@b Changeling Names}: Aunn, Bin, Cas, Dox, Fie, Hars, Jin, Lam, Mas, Nix, Ot, Paik, Ruz, Sim, Toox, Vil, Yug

reward.name: The Chosen of Pelor
entries: As a Chosen of Pelor, you recieved a piece of the sun god when he was killed by Bane. Becoming a Chosen of Pellor is a supernatural gifts that bestows upon you the following traits.

entries.name: Holy Remnants
entries: If you are a paladin or cleric, your Spellcasting Ability granted by your class is not effected by the death of your diety.

entries.name: Radiant Consumption
entries: You can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

variantrule.name: Val'noa Warlock
entries: The death of Pelor. The war in Elysium. Bane's rise to power. You were born into a time of great planar conflict, a time where magic will be as necessary a weapon as swords and armor. The patron with whom you have entered a pact knows this, and wants their champions best equipped to do their bidding. As an extra tenant to your pact, none of the spells added to your Warlock spell list count against your number of known spells.

Traveling over a frozen mountain, a halfling spots a stack of stones on the trail before her. Counting three tall and then seeing one to the left, she turns that direction and continues on her way. She'll never know how close she was to the den of an ice troll.
A human whistles a call on his pan flute, then waits patiently for the reply. A tone comes from his right, and following it he finds the injured stranger he heard signaling for help.

A young elf lights two fires in the desert, each sixty feet apart. He paces between them nervously, waiting five minutes. Ten. Then suddenly a half-orc comes from one of the hills of sand, offering a friendly smile and directions to the nearest town.

entries.name: Signals in the Natural World
entries: Whether solitary or living in circle groups, druids weave among the natural world in order to maintain balance between it and the humanoid races. One of the tools they use to achieve this is the Druidic, a secret language used to communicate over large gaps of space and time.

entries.name: I Spy...
entries: The primary aspect of druidic is visual rather than audible. Long-lasting signals are useful to local druids to steer visitors safely through the area. Long-distance signals help those traveling alone to seek help from the others in the area. Either way, these signals serve to quickly communicate important information for safety and survival.

entries.name: Part of Your Environment
entries: Druidic trail markers are simple enough that they can be adapted to any environment without drawing attention or significantly wounding the land. They are based on numbers and direction, usually requiring no contact between the sender and the recipient.
There are three typical signals that can be created in any environment:

entries.name: Go Straight/Safety
entries: A single marker that doesn't point in a direction indicates you are on a safe path through the area. Examples of this are two stones stacked on top of each other, a single broken branch on a bush, or a section of grass tied in a knot.

entries.name: Turn Right/Left
entries: A single marker that points in a direction indicates the safest or quickest path turns in that direction. This is often a modified "safety" marker. Examples are a stack of two stones with a third to one side, a twig placed on the ground with its leaves pointing one way, or a section of grass tied and bent to one side.

entries.name: Danger/Warning
entries: A marker that appears as a group of three and doesn't indicate a direction means there is danger in the area. Examples are a stack of three stones, three twigs tied together as a tripod, or three bundles of grass knotted right next to each other.

The danger marker is notable for often being accompanied by other communications. For example, danger combined with a turn marker indicates the quickest and safest way to avoid the threat. The druid may have also mentioned to a nearby plant or animal what the danger is and ask them to pass this information along should a traveler use {@spell Speak with Plants} or {@spell Speak with Animals}.

entries.name: Druidic & Druidcraft
entries: In order to communicate more information via Druidic, consider the ways druids may use {@spell Druidcraft} to augment their messages, and what they may mean when paired with certain markers.
Some examples include:

items: Making flowers bloom near a turn marker may indicate a meadow or farming town in that direction.
An odor of rot and decay left with a danger marker may indicate the area is poisoned or that undead roam there.
Leaving a specific seed pod to be opened by another druid may signal to keep on the lookout for that plant, either as a rendezvous point or because it's poisonous.

entries: Also consider how {@spell Druidcraft} on its own may constitute a Druidic message. For example, a flower blooming out-of-season or in an area it isn't naturally found. These messages are likely more personal in nature: for example, a form of identification or threat for an individual, or a shared code used within a specific circle.

entries.name: Send Up a Flare
entries: While most druidic communication is not time-sensitive, occasionally there is need to send important messages quickly. For this purpose, druidic employs the use of smoke signals in order to send word across long distances. The number of fires used communicates different messages.

entries.name: One Fire
entries: A single fire is a simple indication of "I am here." While many druids do not seek contact for a single fire, they may check to see who is in their area or take note that travelers are passing through.

entries.name: Two Fires
entries: Two fires spread approximately 60 feet apart indicates the person setting them is lost. Friendly druids may come and offer assistance for free, while others may ask for a favor or coin in compensation.

entries.name: Three Fires
entries: Three fires spread 60 feet apart is used to communicate good news. This is often used when a search party was organized and the subject was found safely. Generally, only druids who know what the good news might be will respond to this signal.

entries.name: Four Fires
entries: Four fires spread 60 feet apart is a request for direct contact or an area-wide meeting. All druids in the area will usually at least check to see what's happening, though not all of them will make themselves known to strangers.

Spells and cantrips that manipulate the wind may also be used to change the shape of the smoke cloud for more detailed messaging. This can be a simple shape or a complex shadow play, depending on the skill of the spellcaster.

entries.name: Whistling on the Wind
entries: Visual signals are useful to facilitate a meet-up or ensure you never need one. However, they are largely one-way. When a task at hand requires a dialogue instead, Druidic employs auditory cues that can be used as both initiation and response.

entries.name: A Little Birdy Told Me
entries: While any local animal that lives in family groups may be the basis of auditory Druidic, the most common derivative is bird calls because of their ability to pierce long distances. Using instruments or vocals, there are several types of calls used to communicated through Druidic.

entries.name: Flight Calls
entries: Also called "formation calls," this call helps communicate where you are in relation to other druids. This can be used to keep certain distances apart for search parties, long-distance travel, or battle formations.

entries.name: Contact Calls
entries: These calls are used to keep in contact with other druids when formation is not important. It is used to arrange meet-ups with strangers or keep tabs on friends.

entries.name: Separation Calls
entries: Used to locate someone who has become lost from their group or traveling companions. Unless you know who's sending it, it's {@i faux pas}  to respond; they are looking for a specific person, not general assistance.

entries.name: Begging Calls
entries: This call is used by lone druids who are lost or injured, essentially sending an S.O.S. to the locals.

entries.name: Alarm Calls
entries: Alarm calls are warnings to other druids that danger has been spotted, and the best course of action is to lie low and avoid it.

entries.name: Rallying Calls
entries: Similar to alarm calls, rallying calls indicate danger. However, a rally call is used to organize a group to attack the threat and remove it, rather than simply avoid it.

entries.name: Your Circle and Your Calls
entries: If a druid is part of a specific druid circle, consider that circle and what animal it would base its druidic calls on.

For example, the {@class druid|phb|Circle of the Moon|Moon} may prefer to use the calls of predators and raptors to communicate with each other. Druids that operate mostly at night (such as the {@class druid|phb|Circle of the Stars|Stars|TCE}) will be more likely to use nocturnal animals than diurnal ones.
Even without a specific circle, druid players and DMs should work together to determine the specific culture that they from and how their druidic calls reflect it.

While the exact sound of each call varies by the animal being mimicked, they are often close enough in volume and tone to identify their purpose. In this way, even visiting druids can communicate audibly without knowing the local animals.

entries.name: Example Use of Druidic Calls
entries: A druid who belongs to the Circle of the Coast climbs over bluffs and crags, surveying driftwood left behind by a recent storm. A friend has agreed to meet with her here, but she hasn't found them yet.

Pulling out her flute, the young lady mimics the {@i contact call}  of a gull. The sound of the instrument differs enough from the birds that they won't respond, but if her friend hears her, they might.

While listening for the reply, she hears a different noise she didn't expect. It sounds like a {@i begging call} , but of a bird she doesn't recognize. Something from the forest, maybe? But the nearest forest is dozens of miles from here.

Starting in the direction she heard the noise, she plays her flute again with a {@i separation call}. She hopes whoever's listening will be able to connect the dots as she did. The begging call sounds back again, and she responds as she follows it slowly down the cliff.

Rounding a corner as she prepares to play her call again, the druid stops short at the sight of a man, ragged and soaked. He cups his hands around his mouth and sounds the begging call again, to which she replies and catches his attention. Jogging close, she sees his leg is pinned by a boulder and surrounded by flotsam; he must have been shipwrecked in the previous bad weather.

The stone is large and slick, something she can't move by herself. Reaching for her flute again, she begins a {@i contact call}  before she sees her friend silhouetted at the top of the cliff. They pull out their shawm and respond in kind, waving before they transform into a hawk and fly down to assist the stranger.

classFeature.name: Val'noa Warlock
entries: As an extra tenant to your pact, none of the spells added to your Warlock spell list count against your number of known spells.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Soul
entries: One day a light blazed forth within you—the illumination of psionic power. Your mind now simmers with this power, the full extent of which you won't fully grasp for years to come. You can touch other minds with it and alter the world around you by using it to control the magical energy of the multiverse. Will this power shine from you as a hopeful beacon to others? Or will you be a source of terror to those who feel the stab of your mind and witness the strange manifestations of your might?

Among githyanki and githzerai, the powers of Psionic Soul sorcerers are revered and marshaled on both sides of the gith war. In Eberron, many kalashtar dream of discovering this origin's abilities within themselves, and in Athas, more sorcerers are born with a Psionic Soul than with any other source of power. In the glades of primeval woods touched by the Feywild, children sometimes awaken to the wonders of psionic power. And in communities that survive Far Realm incursions, some folk are mutated into horrific aberrations, while a lucky few not only remain themselves, but also discover that psionic energy now suffuses their minds.

As a Psionic Soul sorcerer, you decide how you acquired your powers. Were you born with them, and did they manifest throughout childhood? Or did an extraordinary event later in life leave you shining with psionic awareness? Consult the Psionic Origins table for a possible origin of your power.

entries.caption: Psionic Origins
rows: You were exposed to the Far Realm's warping influence. You can now use your mind in ways you never thought possible, and you're also convinced that a tendril is growing upon you.
A psychic wind from the Astral Plane carried psionic energy into your being. When you use your powers now, faint motes of light sparkle around you.
You or your ancestor were trained by a githzerai monk to unlock the psionic potential within yourself.
A spirit haunts your mind, lending incredible power to your thoughts. When you sleep, the spirit's memories invade your dreams.

Deep in a forest touched by the Feywild, you drank from a glimmering stream, and now your mind shines with power. Beasts and fey creatures are often now friendly to you, as if they can sense the light within you.
Upon recovering from a near-fatal injury, you found yourself with psionic powers. Whenever you use them, your old wound tingles.
You were implanted with a mind flayer tadpole, but the ceremorphosis never completed. And now the psionic power is yours. When you use it, your flesh shines with a strange mucus.
As a child, you had an imaginary friend that looked like a flumph or a strange platypuslike creature. One day, it gifted you with psionic powers, which have ended up being not so imaginary.
Your nightmares whisper the truth to you: your psionic powers are not your own. You draw them from your vestigial twin!
You grew up near the lair of a sapphire dragon, and now your eyes glow with sapphire light when you use your newfound powers.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: {@i 1st-level Psionic Soul feature}

You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by your Psionic Energy dice, which are each a {@dice d6}. You have a number of these dice equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and they fuel various psionic powers you have, which are detailed below.

Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy die they use, as specified in a power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use a die when your dice are all expended. You regain all your expended Psionic Energy dice when you finish a long rest. In addition, as a bonus action, you can regain one expended Psionic Energy die, but you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach certain levels in this class, the size of your Psionic Energy dice increases: at 5th level ({@dice d8}), 11th level ({@dice d10}), and 17th level ({@dice d12}).
The powers below use your Psionic Energy dice.

entries.name: Psionic Discovery.
entries: You can unlock the ability to cast a mind-oriented sorcerer spell you don't already know. After meditating for 10 minutes (which can be done during a rest), expend one Psionic Energy die, roll the die, and choose a sorcerer spell of a level for which you have spell slots and that is {@filter a divination or an enchantment spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=D;E|level=1;2;3;4;5}. You know the chosen spell for a number of hours equal to the number you rolled.

entries.name: Psychic Sorcery.
entries: When you cast a spell, you can use your mind to form it, rather than relying on words, gestures, and materials. To do so, expend one Psionic Energy die and roll it. The spell then requires no verbal component, and if you rolled the level of the spell or higher, the spell doesn't require somatic or material components either.

entries.name: Telepathic Speech.
entries: You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see, and roll your Psionic Energy die. For a number of hours equal to the number you rolled, you and the chosen creature can speak telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to the number you rolled. To understand each other, you each must speak mentally in a language the other knows. The telepathic connection ends early if you use this ability to form a connection with a different creature.
The first time you use this power after each long rest, you don't expend the Psionic Energy die. All other times you use the power, you expend the die.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Strike
entries: {@i 6th-level Psionic Soul feature}

You have learned to channel additional psychic energy into your spells. Immediately after you deal damage to a creature with a sorcerer spell for which you expend a spell slot, you can expend one Psionic Energy die and also deal psychic damage to that creature equal to the number rolled. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Defense
entries: {@i 6th-level Psionic Soul feature}
You gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Over Body
entries: {@i 14th-level Psionic Soul feature}

You can now use the psi that flows through you to give your body extraordinary abilities. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 or more sorcery points to magically transform your body for 10 minutes. For each sorcery point you spend, you can gain one of the following benefits of your choice, the effects of which last until the transformation ends:

items: You can see any {@condition invisible} creature within 60 feet of you, provided it isn't behind total cover.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and you can hover.
You gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Aura
entries: {@i 18th-level Psionic Soul feature}

You can unleash your psionic power in a crackling aura of psychic energy; as a bonus action, you can magically radiate this transparent, 30-foot-radius aura for 1 minute or until you're {@condition incapacitated}.

Whenever a creature starts its turn in the aura or moves into it for the first time on a turn, you can deal psychic damage to the creature, equaling {@damage 1d12} plus your Charisma modifier. If the creature takes any of this damage, its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend three Psionic Energy dice to use it again.
